ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: This is a practicum, so we were required to work at least 8-10 hours/week on our projects. Outside of my placement, I spent about 8-10 hours working on project status updates and my final paper/portfolio.

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: Strengths - gained experienced in a different public health setting! Weaknesses - I wish I had started at my placement earlier.

The course is highly organized, and includes great dinners and things to go along with it. I'm not sure I would have any suggestions other than to continue seeking feedback from people as they conclude their placements and consider expanding to New York as well (since there are awesome orgs there, like MSF, that would be amazing to work with).

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley did a great job organizing the course and placements, checking-in, making suggestions, and facilitating discussion between others in the class.

Instructor: Shelley Geballe  Shelley Geballe is friendly, approachable, and highly knowledgable. Through discussion about experienced during the semester, I learned a lot from her, and would consider her an absolute assett to the experience.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great way to gain hands-on experience in a public health agency. It takes a time commitment, so be willing to dedicate at least 10hrs/week to the placement.

You work in the field with an organization on health policy. I would suggest you really consider each placement option for how well it aligns with your interests and experience, and I think this course should be a requirement for those not pursuing a thesis.
